That sounds great. I have been aware of the new features but for various
go=
od reasons have been unable to try them out. (You can think of me as stuck
=
back at 4.0 if that helps). Are there any overviews of the new features tha=
t
you could point me towards so that I can see how to try them out?

Simon
=

On Wed, Aug 4, 2010 at 3:43 PM, Joakim Ohlrogge
<joakim.ohlrogge@...=
>wrote:

> Hi Simon, you asked for ideas on where new features could be sui=
table. I
> think theories would emphasize the global applicability of some =
rules like:
> symmetry of equality, an object should always equal itself et=
c. Two
> examples
> to illustrate:
>
> @Theory equalsIsSymetrical(BinaryDig=
it bd1, BinaryDigit bd2) {
>    assertEquals(bd1.equals(bd2), bd2.equals(bd=
1));
> }
>
> @Theory anInstanceAlwaysEqualsItself(BinaryDigit bd) {
>    as=
sertTrue(bd.equals(bd));
> }
>
> I think it shows more clearly that this is=
 true for any instance of
> BinaryDigit and not just the ones used to show =
the same thing in a normal
> @Test annotated test.
>
> For this to work you=
 have to add the @RunWith(Theories.class) annotaion and
> annotate the Bina=
ryDigit instances as DataPoints.
>
> Thanks for posting this code.
> ------=
